akn:content.akn:p: §§ 1151 to 1165. Omitted Editorial Notes Codification Sections 1151 to 1165 of this title were omitted as superseded by Pub. L. 92–500, § 2, Oct. 18, 1972, 86 Stat. 816. See section 1251 et seq. of this title. Section 1151, acts June 30, 1948, ch. 758, § 1, 62 Stat. 1155; July 9, 1956, ch. 518, § 1, 70 Stat. 498; July 20, 1961, Pub. L. 87–88, § 1(a), 75 Stat. 204; Oct. 2, 1965, Pub. L. 89–234, § 1(a), 79 Stat. 903; 1966 Reorg. Plan No. 2, §§ 1(a), (e)(1), 5, eff. May 10, 1966, 31 F.R. 6857, 80 Stat. 1608; 1970 Reorg. Plan No. 3, § 2(a)(1), eff. Dec. 2, 1970, 35 F.R. 15623, 84 Stat. 2087, related to Congressional declaration of policy in controlling water pollution. Section 1152, act June 30, 1948, ch. 758, § 2, as added Oct. 2, 1965, Pub. L. 89–234, § 2(a), 79 Stat. 903; amended 1966 Reorg. Plan No. 2, § 1(a), (b), eff. May 10, 1966, 31 F.R. 6857, 80 Stat. 1608; Apr. 3, 1970, Pub. L. 91–224, title I, § 110(a), 84 Stat. 113, created within the Department of the Interior a Federal Water Quality Administration. Reorg. Plan No. 3 of 1970, §§ 1, 2(a)(1), 6(a)(1), eff. Dec. 2, 1970, 35 F.R. 15623, 84 Stat. 2086, 2087, 2089, created Environmental Protection Agency, abolished Federal Water Quality Administration in Department of the Interior, and transferred to Administrator of Environmental Protection Agency all functions vested by law in Secretary of the Interior and Department of the Interior which had been administered through Federal Water Quality Administration. Section 1153, acts June 30, 1948, ch. 758, § 3, formerly § 2, 62 Stat. 1155; July 9, 1956, ch. 518, § 1, 70 Stat. 498; July 20, 1961, Pub. L. 87–88, §§ 1(b), 2, 75 Stat. 204; renumbered Oct. 2, 1965, Pub. L. 89–234, § 2(a), 79 Stat. 903; amended Nov. 3, 1966, Pub. L. 89–753, title I, § 101, 80 Stat. 1246; 1970 Reorg. Plan No. 3, § 2(a)(1), eff. Dec. 2, 1970, 35 F.R. 15623, 84 Stat. 2086, related to preparation and development of comprehensive water pollution programs. Section 1154, acts June 30, 1948, ch. 758,
